pull.title: [travis] add zmq python module, re-enable zmq rpc tests
pull.body:
Travis can't run the zmq tests because its missing the python zmq module.
https://travis-ci.org/bitcoin/bitcoin/jobs/80832394#L3588

**This would install the python zmq module and re-enable the rpc tests**.
Disabling zmq tests on travis would be another solution, but IMO we should maximize the CI test coverage.

Not sure if this is a good solution (@theuni?).

Let's discuss this before merging.

events.body: ACK - is both necessary and correct

rename.to: [travis] add zmq python module and re-enable zmq rpc tests on travis

rename.from: [travis] add zmq python module and re-enable zmq rpc tests on travis
rename.to: [travis] add zmq python module, re-enable zmq rpc tests

rename.from: [travis] add zmq python module, re-enable zmq rpc tests
rename.to: [travis] [please don't merge yet / under work] add zmq python module, re-enable zmq rpc tests

events.body: Looks like Travis timed out on a couple of jobs.

Somehow even if travis successfully installs `libzmq3` and `python-zmq`, the rpc test can't connect over zmq with bitcoind.
Still try to figure out why...
Does this work locally? It's not clear to me what needs to be native and what needs to be per-arch.

@theuni 
The zmq_test.py (RPC test) works prefect locally. Tested on OSX/Debian and Ubuntu.
The `zmq_test.py` changes within this PR are for debugging purposes. 
I can only encounter the problem in Travis builds.
It looks like that zmq tcp:// connection does not work in travis. Even after installing python-zmq. Also my solution (`sudo rm -f /etc/apt/sources.list.d/travis_ci_zeromq3-source.list;`) looks after a workaround hack.
Maybe you have a different approach to get the zmq_test.py running on travis.

issue.title: Regression Tests: Migrated rpc-tests.sh to all Python rpc-tests.py
issue.body:
1) created rpc-tests.py
2) deleted rpc-tests.sh
3) deleted tests-config.sh.in
4) travis.yml points to rpc-tests.py

events.body: @theuni: Any idea how we could fix this? Having CI tests for the ZMQ would be important IMO otherwise the risks are high that things break without noticing.
@jonasschnelli I need to spend a bit of time learning about the intricacies of zmq/python here. But I'll try to track down the issue.

issue.title: Require ZMQ version 4.x and update/cleanup zmq docs
issue.body:
This PR changes the configure.ac to require ZMQ version 4.x or newer, which is provided on Debian and derivatives as package libzmq3-dev.  It also updates the release notes, build-unix.md, and zmq.md docs to reflect this change and add missing documentation.

(Whitespace changes are purely trimming of extraneous previous whitespace by my editor.)

events.body: @jonasschnelli This fixes: https://github.com/theuni/bitcoin/commit/05a7243678e97b3944c5ceb23c4b05c57fb9c42f . Problem was the old libzmq that the pyzmq was using. Installing the newer pyzmq from a ppa pulls in newer versions of both.

rename.to: [travis] add zmq python module, re-enable zmq rpc tests

events.body:
Added @theuni commit.
Travis is happy now.
This would add CI coverage of the ZMQ feature.

events.message: travis: install a recent libzmq and pyzmq for tests
